Replying to @dotNetCoreShow 2019-08-07 21:58
@dotNetCoreShow @Netlify @GoHugoIO For launches and releases, at @Netlify (!) we‚Äôll often disable auto-publishing then build our release. This locks the site while readying the new version. Then you can release it in seconds. @biilmann did this on stage in the video here: https://t.co/uB2Uao5UWa

Replying to @DavidDarnes 2019-08-07 21:04
@DavidDarnes @maggerbo @Ghost @eleven_ty @Netlify A pattern I‚Äôve used for a lot with a variety of SSGs is to have something like Gulp run the build. It pulls data from APIs, stashes it in the data files the SSG prefers, then generates the site with the SSG. This can keep your options open so you can choose the tool you prefer.
